# Homework

- "individual" means: Everybody does the task on their own and uploads an individual report/result.
- "group" means: The working group submits a joint document.

## Homework 1 (individual)

**Practice *p*-hacking**: [https://www.shinyapps.org/apps/p-hacker/](https://www.shinyapps.org/apps/p-hacker/)

**Task:**
Hack at least 5 studies towards significance with $\alpha = .05$ (keep the true effect at 0).
Whenever you achieved a significant result, click on "Save" in the results table to store your result in the study stack on the right side. Once you achieved 5 significant studies, copy and paste the study stack into a text document. Keep a short log of the steps that were necessary to achieve significance (e.g., "increase sample size 2 times by 10 participants, controlled for SES").

Next, try the same for $\alpha = .005$ (if it takes too long, there's no need to achieve 5 significant studies).

**Deliverable**:
Copy both sets of significant studies (one for $\alpha = .05$, one for $\alpha = .005$) and your log into the textfield in the Moodle task.


## Homework 2 (individual)

- Create an [ORCID ID](https://orcid.org). You can use "LMU" as affiliation.
- Create an [OSF](https://osf.io) account (use your real name; link your ORCID ID).
